alert.note: Alert for Monroe Lower Keys; Monroe Middle Keys; Monroe Upper Keys (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued November 08 at 9:30PM EST until November 09 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Key West
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT... * WHAT...Water level gauges across the Florida Keys measured water levels about a foot higher than normal high tides this evening. With the expected northerly winds Wednesday and Wednesday night across the Florida Keys, the next round of high tides Wednesday evening and overnight could reach 2 feet above normal high tides, or about 1 foot higher than Tuesday`s high tide. * WHERE...Florida Keys. * WHEN...Tonight through at least Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Minor saltwater flooding of low elevation streets and lots is likely. Some storm drains will overflow, and some seawalls and docks will be overtopped. Boaters can expect less clearance under fixed bridges. Motorists should remember that persistent puddles around the times of high tide are almost certain to contain a mix of saltwater.
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Monroe Lower Keys; Monroe Middle Keys; Monroe Upper Keys
